title: What are the goals of green technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: There isn’t a specific set of rules. Sustainability, meaning things that can be done without depleting natural resources, clean, meaning not poisoning people, animals, plants or places where anything living might be desired in the future. You asked about “technology” which either includes or excludes a huge area of sustainable agriculture and forest management, depending on whether you mean the equipment itself, or just knowledge about the living things and what they require. I’m tempted to say that green technology is a direction, not a place. But often, where you want to go isn’t as important as where you are starting the journey from. We all know that fossil fuels are responsible for a large share of climate change, but many of us forgot that fossil fuels are also responsible for killing a million people worldwide every year, and sending 100 million people to doctors’ offices. That was easier to forget when there was no economic alternative. But now that solving climate change is cheaper than not solving it, we need to remind ourselves that this several months of clear skies due to the virus and lockdowns is not just pretty. It is also critical to the health of a lot of people. Green technology ultimately means all technology where unsustainable impacts can be identified, and alternatives are available. Not all possible green technology will be adopted, and we will have some disagreements on which alternative is greener. I do expect that once we are on the path to ending fossil fuels the world’s perspective on environmental protection will shift because all the new jobs and economic growth will give people a more rational sense of how it all fits together.
